posts.author: CriticalMiss
posts.content:
For my next character, I want to focus on ways as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

The way I understand the rules for ways, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that ways functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about ways. Based on my experience, it works differently.
